territory.notes: From 1713 to 1825, Newfoundland was an imperial possession. In 1825, it was designated a colony. From 1907 to 1949, Newfoundland was a self-governing dominion; however, from 1934 to 1949, Newfoundland was governed by the Commission of Government, as a result of financial troubles stemming from the Great Depression. In 1949, Newfoundland joined Canada.

sources.source: Robert Bothwell, The Penguin History of Canada (Penguin, 2007)
